description: "The sitter is shown as a half-length figure, facing left against a grey background. He is wearing a brown robe and the dark brownish beige fur lining is visible on the broad lapels. The man has dark thinning hair and long sideburns  \n[Görres, cda 2016]"
provenance: "- 1869 bought from the Galerie Leon Gauchez, Paris\n\n[Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, 138, No. 331]"
medium: "Painting on beech wood\n[Heydenreich 2010 A, 72]"
signature: "Artist's insignia to the left of the sitter's proper right shoulder: winged serpent, facing right with elevated wings and dated '1529'; in black paint\n[Kunsthistorisches Museum, revised 2011]"
inscription: "- top edge:\nremains of an earlier inscription visible in the IR-reflectograph\n- bottom right corner:\nremains of a coat-of-arms visible in the IR-reflectograph"
markings: "Recto on the painted surface:\n\n- top left:\n'Johannes Scheyring Dr.'\n\nReverse on the cradle:\n\n- top centre: \nRemains of a paper label \n\n- centre: \nRound custom's (?)stamp (black); small square stamp: 'D.B / MD 1'; printed paper label: 'MUSEES ROYAUX DES BEAUX-ARTS DE BELGIQUE / Auteur / Sujet / Inventaire No [printed], Cranach, Lucas /Portrait du Dr. Scheyring. / 2033 [handwritten in black ink]' \n\n- bottom centre: \nPrinted paper label: 'SOCIETE AUXILIAIRE DES EXPOSITIONS DU PALAIS / DES BEAUX ARTS / [...] Rue Royale  Bruxelles / Exposition: / Titre de l'oeuvre / Collection: [printed] XXVe Am[?] iressive / Cranach: Dr. Scheyring / Coll. Musee de Bruxelles [handwritten in black ink]'"
